articles.title: President Kim Il Sung is eternal sun of Juche
Festival posters off press
Preparatory committees formed abroad
articles.content:
Festival posters off press
   Pyongyang, March 31 (KCNA) -- Posters on the 17th April Spring Friendship Art Festival have come off the press in Korea on the threshold of significant Sun's Day.   The posters mirror the desire and aspiration of the Korean people and the progressive mankind to more significantly commemorate their common holiday.   They have various themes and styles,  including the one which depicts artistes from different countries singing in praise of the President Kim Il Sung in Mangyongdae, the time-honored cradle of revolution, the one which portrays foreign artistes eulogizing Kimilsungia which is in full bloom all over the world, the one depicting pigeons flying in the sky above Pyongyang, the festival city, as well as the one showing artistes who sing songs of independence, peace and friendship with the festival mark held aloft.

articles.title: Struggle for right to existence supported
articles.content:
Preparatory committees formed abroad
   Pyongyang, March 31 (KCNA) -- Preparatory committees for commemorating Sun's Day were inaugurated in Democratic Congo, Sri Lanka, Belgium and Pakistan on the occasion of the 87th birth anniversary of the President Kim Il Sung.   Preparatory committees decided to hold colorful events around Sun's Day.   In another development, a preparatory committee of the United Confederation of Koreans in Russia was formed on March 24 to commemorate Sun's Day.

articles.title: DPRK exposes nature of planned U.S. "NMD" system
Provocative "Hoguk 99" joint military exercise
Nonsense of anti-reunification element
articles.content:
Provocative "Hoguk 99" joint military exercise
    Pyongyang, March 31 (KCNA) -- The South Korean war hawks started on March 28 a week-long provocative  "Hoguk 99" military exercise allegedly to cope with a "contingency," a Seoul-based radio said.   They reportedly called the South Korean ground force "Jingun" (onward march) and other units under it out to hold an "exercise reminiscent of a real war involving 28 important aspects in the event of emergency, including air attack, reconnaissance and removal of effects of chemical, biological and radioactive attacks, air re-supply and ammunition supply."   They will appoint the commander of a unit "Sonbong" (vanguard) and major staffers as "supervisors" for the first time in the history of maneuvers to intensify control and examination of the joint military exercise and choose a "rival army" with a view to staging the exercise under the simulated conditions of a real war, the radio said.   Meanwhile, the South Korean ruling quarters called combat flying corps No. 1 of the air force out to wage a "chemical warfare and coordinated exercise for base defense" allegedly to cope with "emergency."

articles.title: Mun Ik Hwan's devoted service to national reunification
articles.content:
Nonsense of anti-reunification element
    Pyongyang, March 31 (KCNA) -- The South Korean "Minister of Foreign Affairs and Trade" reportedly reiterated on March 29 the anti-reunification "engagement policy toward the north" at a meeting in Berlin,  saying that the U.S. military presence in South Korea was necessary to relax the tensions on the Korean peninsula."    He went so far as to assert that "the issue of the U.S. military presence in South Korea should not be included in agenda items of negotiations" with the north.   These remarks meant to keep the U.S. aggression forces in South Korea indefinitely on the pretext of "easing tensions" are one more clear evidence of the separatist intention of despicable traitors to justify the U.S. military occupation of South Korea, a source of increasing tensions and division of the Korean peninsula and prolong their remaining days in reliance upon it.

articles.title: Staunch defender of Juche idea
articles.content:
Mun Ik Hwan's devoted service to national reunification
   Pyongyang, March 31 (KCNA) -- A decade has passed since Rev. Mun Ik Hwan, a famous dissident of South Korea, visited Pyongyang to meet the President Kim Il Sung, whom he looked up to and followed as the center of great national unity.    Rev. Mun was advisor to the "Coalition for National Democratic Movement" in South Korea.    In January Juche 78 (1989) the President, when making New Year address, proposed to convene a north-south political consultative meeting and invited South Korean personages, including  Rev. Mun to visit Pyongyang.
   In response to the invitation, Rev. Mun released a statement hailing and fully supporting the proposal.    Rev. Mun at the advanced age of 70 made a long journey to come to Pyongyang.    On March 27 the President met Rev. Mun who came to the north at the risk of his life, had sincere talks with him about reunification and on April 1 called at the place where he put up.   After the meeting with the President, Rev. Mun said that he was so  moved by the President's genuine love for the country and nation, stand of national independence and unshakable will for reunification at the first ever meeting with the President that he felt that the wall of division was falling down in a wink.   
   Upon his return to the south, Rev. Mun voiced support for reunification by confederacy formula through great national unity despite suppression by the authorities, said the verb for the noun reunification should be in "perfect tense" and fought till the last moment of his life, not abandoning his faith and will to put the President's idea of national reunification into practice.    The President made sure that the "reunification prize" was awarded to Rev. Mun for his devoted service to for the national reunification movement.
